becker.xtras.connect4
Class Connect4

java.lang.Object
  becker.xtras.connect4.Connect4

public class Connect4
extends Object

A class implementing the logic for the game of Connect Four (trademarked by HASBRO, Inc., used with permission). The gameboard has seven columns, each with space for up to six tokens. Two players take turns placing different colored tokens. Each token is placed in the "top" of a column where it "falls" to either the bottom of the column (if no previous tokens were placed in the column) or on to the top of the most recently placed token.

The first player to have four tokens in a row either horizonally, vertically or diagonally, wins the game.

A program using this class is developed in Chapter 9, Input and Output in the textbook Robots: Learning to Program with Java.

Author:
Byron Weber Becker

Method Detail

placeToken

public void placeToken(int col)
Place a token for the human player in the designated column. The computer will immediately place its token in response (provided the game is not over).

Parameters:
col - the column where the token should be placed. One of {1..Board.NUMCOLS}. The column must not already be full.

isLegalMove

public boolean isLegalMove(int col)
Is a particular move legal?

Parameters:
col - The proposed move
Returns:
true if the proposed move is legal; false otherwise.

getEndOfGameMessage

public String getEndOfGameMessage()
Get a message declaring the winner. The game must be over.

Returns:
a message offering congratulations or condolences, as appropriate

initGame

public void initGame(boolean humanGoesFirst)
Initialize a new game.

Parameters:
humanGoesFirst - True if the human player should have the first move; false if the computer should move first.

getBoard

public String getBoard()
Get a printable representation of the current board.

Returns:
a printable representation of the current board.

isOver

public boolean isOver()
Is the game over?

Returns:
true if the game is over; false otherwise.

setDifficulty

public void setDifficulty(int d)
Set the difficulty level for the computer player.

Parameters:
d - One of Connect4.{MIN_DIFFICULTY,...,MAX_DIFFICULTY}
